page.title: 14Life in Ayot St.Lawrence:2
page.content: Many people have a home computer but only one person,each,has a C.B. Radio,car telephone or metal disc hi-fi. The amount of cars that belong to people in Ayot village, around two per family,are mainly manual. No daily papers are delivered to the village and the families who get papers mainly read The Times followed by The Telegraph,The Guardian and then The Financial Times. Most people shop in Harpenden for their groceries. The other main place is Welwyn Garden City. Many people grow their own vegetables and a few keep poultry. Most of the few children of school age attend state schools.
